intro: Tabernaemontana phymata, commonly known as the rough-leaved star-of-Bethlehem, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa. It belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its striking, star-shaped flowers that bloom in spring. The plant features broad, rough-textured leaves that are often a deep green color. It thrives in well-drained soil and prefers full sun to partial shade. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in gardens for its beauty and resilience.
